snippet: More and more Sudanese have begun challenging their government, but it is unclear if a real Arab Spring has reached the country.
abstract: Memo From Africa; many Sudanese have begun challenging their government, but it is unclear if a real Arab Spring has reached the country; circumstances seem right for a protest against a repressive, autocratic regime that has been in power 23 years; many Sudan experts are skeptical that the government is in danger of falling.

byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush contributed reporting from Khartoum, Sudan.

lead_paragraph: More and more Sudanese have begun challenging their government, but it is unclear if a real Arab Spring has reached the country.

headline.main: Dissent Sprouts in Sudan, but It May Not Be Arab Spring
headline.print_headline: Dissent Sprouts in Sudan, But It May Not Be Spring
